text: Best Arabian food Iâ€™ve ever tasted in Singapore. Price is also reasonable. Recommended!

Dined in. I ordered  Chicken Kebab with Rice. Food price I felt was slightly cheaper compared to other Mediterranean foods and the portion was generous. It was served warm when I was dining in, and tasted great to me.

What looks like the owner seems to be quite fierce looking but was generous when i asked for extra mayo for my son. Worth a try
If you want good Arabic food go to Century Squareâ€™s Arabiaaaa ! The price is reasonable and portion is huge, so come with some friends for the Arabic feast.

Arabiaaa Changi Village! Ordered KEBAB MIX WITH FRIES and was served bland food-stir fried steamed chicken & stir fried sliced beef whilst claiming it's KEBAB?! Fries seems refried ðŸ¤¢. Food wasnt warm at all! A wasted trip & $$ here. Had a bad diarrhoea!

New stall at the food market! Haig Road Putu Piring - tried their original flavour (Gula Melaka). Itâ€™s a little too sweet for my liking. All flavors comes in a box of 4@$3.50. The shop gave me a box of kueh dadar to try. The coconut filing is quite sweet but the skin is not too thick. Goes well together.
